data: Remote Laser Welding System Navigator for Eco & Resilient Automotive Factories

RLW Navigator aims to develop an innovative Process Navigator to configure, integrate, test and validate applications of Remote Laser Welding (RLW) in automotive assembly addressing today's critical needs for frequently changing operating conditions and product-mix provisions. Thus, RLW Navigator will crucially serve as an enabler for future energy efficient smart factories. RLW is emerging as a promising joining technology for sheet metal assembly due to benefits on several fronts including reduced processing time, (50-75%) and decreased factory floor footprint (50%), reduced environmental impact through energy use reduction (60%), and providing a flexible process base for future model introduction or product change. Currently, RLW systems are limited in their applicability due to an acute lack of systematic ICT-based simulation methodologies to navigate their efficient application in automotive manufacturing processes. The project aims to address this by developing a Process Navigator simulation system that will deal with three key challenges thereby allowing manufacturers to utilize the advantages of the RLW system.Firstly, the most critical obstacle that currently prevents the successful implementation of RLW is the need for tight dimensional control of part-to-part gap during joining operations, essential to ensure the quality of the stitch.Secondly, the existing assembly system architecture must be reconfigured to provide the opportunity to evaluate the RLW system in terms of its feasibility to perform all required assembly tasks. This will provide crucial information about the most advantageous workstation/cell reconfiguration, which will serve as the basis for optimal robot path planning to reduce joining process time and workstation level efficiency assessment.Finally the project will develop systematic evaluation and learning methods to assess and improve the overall performance, cost-effectiveness and eco-efficiency of the RLW system.
Kokapstrādes ražošanas apmācības metožu pilnveidošana prakšu vadītājiem

The timber industry has a special role in the Latvian economy , which has been one of the main drivers of export. Evaluating the timber industry for young professionals professional knowledge and skills, noticed a low level of practical professional skills and the ability to independently solve the problems. This could be explained by the lack of practice.
Project "Improving Wood-processing Industry Training Methods for Practice Managers” support 4 VET practice managers / human resources specialists professional development work in the form of job shadowing in professional educational organizations or companies of United Kingdom and Portugal.
The project participants will be involved in advanced professional wood processing industry professional pedagogy , including term professional learning and practical application of the business, as well as knowledge of innovative methods of work and the skills to use them in the processing operations. It is also necessary to expand the experience of participants on the state of the industry outside of Latvian.
Such capacity building will Severnvale Academy, UK job shadowing will take place 14 days. The project will be used for job watching, practical testing and exchange of experience methodology.
The job shadowing in Portugal will provide the learning mobility of participants to acquire the knowledge, skills and competencies wood processing industry development technologies in Portugal, as well as a specific focus on the construction of wooden houses, as potential business development. In both countries, the experience will very valuable and benefit to the company's development, which will provide the opportunity to expand practice places in the region and participation in the dual vocational education system. Job shadowing will take place 10 days in Portugal. Different working time for job shadowing related that in the UK  due to, the extra attention will be dedicated to professional English skills improvement and job shadowing at the wood processing industry enterprises. 
Supportive Europass Mobility procedures will be obtained for  the grant recipients and provided  possibility to receive them.
Dissemination of project results will include a wide range of activities including the information at the company's website : http://www.mars-kokapstrade.lv/, specific audiences at the local, regional, state and international levels, ensuring sustainability of the project.
Développement des Expériences Culinaires et Linguistiques à l'International

The project is developped in the context of promotion actions as well as language and cultural skill improvements, addressed to 20 young catering and hospitality high schoolers. As regards our catering training more particularly, it is been fifteen years since the establishment started its actions towards a programme of international oriented development on a European level. The three-year establishment project is focused on international axes mainly for 2015-2016. Lannion being located within an area with a strong touristic activity, it is of the responsibility of the training establishments to get the necessary means to increase the language attractiveness and exchanges with foreign countries in order to make our students improve their skills. Besides, our establishment is a catering and hospitality vocational school which on the one hand aims at making our students enter the local labour market world- students in a face-to-face relationship with foreign customers, and on the other hand it aims at enabling them to have an access to positions abroad.The project mainly focuses on the professional mobility of the learners from the Technological option (Baccalauréat Professionnel). During eight weeks, the students are immersed into a company and take part in its daily activities. As regards the corporate training, our students have to attend it but this has a more important meaning since it takes place in the United-Kingdom, Spain or Sweden. In line with this approach, a programme is also planned for our school teachers so that they can remobilise their language skills and live a cultural experience linked to the country and language they are in charge of teaching.The skills acquired during mobilities abroad will be fully reinvested first in the profit of the students’ daily training in relation with their final training cycle. Moreover, the fact of enclosing that experience in the curriculum vitae reinforces the company interest during its recruitment as regards the application study of the students who don’t have much work experience. For the learners who are planning to study at University the acquired skills will constitute serious assets during the file selection in the post-graduation admission procedure. As far as language teaching is concerned and in European section their acquired fluency removes any apprehension when they speak, the effects are immediate and and have an exceptional impact…Last years’ experiences show that mobility strengthens these skills for a long-lasting period and with efficiency. The skills acquired by the teacher will benefit directly students since the teacher’s language level and skills will be maintained , and on the other hand he will be able to use genuine and real life examples to contextualize his teaching content.
Supporting better environmental governance and information at all levels (07.02.03)
